sad.arabic: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۚ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا ٱكْتَسَبَتْ ۗ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَآ إِن نَّسِينَآ أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَآ إِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦ ۖ وَٱعْفُ عَنَّا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَآ ۚ أَنتَ مَوْلَىٰنَا فَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
sad.transliteration: La yukallifu Allahu nafsan illa wus'aha laha ma kasabat wa'alayha ma iktasabat rabbana la tu'akhithna in naseena aw akhta'na rabbana wala tahmil 'alayna isran kama hamaltahu 'ala allatheena min qablina rabbana wala tuhammilna ma la taqata lana bihi wa'fu 'anna waghfir lana warhamna anta mawlana fansurna 'ala alqawmi alkafirin
sad.translation: Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear. It will have the consequence of what good it has gained, and it will bear the consequence of what evil it has earned. Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.

sad.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
sad.transliteration: Fa inna ma'al 'usri yusra
sad.translation: For indeed, with hardship will be ease.

sad.arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
sad.transliteration: Inna ma'al 'usri yusra
sad.translation: Indeed, with hardship will be ease.

sad.arabic: وَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَوْنَ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
sad.transliteration: Wa la tahinu wa la tahzanu wa antumu al-a'lawna in kuntum mu'mineen
sad.translation: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are true believers.

sad.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
sad.transliteration: Qul ya 'ibadiya allatheena asrafu 'ala anfusihim la taqnatu min rahmati Allahi inna Allaha yaghfiru aththunooba jamee'an innahu huwa alghafooru arraheem
sad.translation: Say, O My servants who have transgressed against themselves by sinning, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

sad.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
sad.transliteration: Ya ayyuha allatheena amanu ista'eenu bissabri wassalah inna Allaha ma'a assabireen
sad.translation: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.

sad.arabic: وَلَلْـَٔاخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
sad.transliteration: Walal-akhiratu khayrun laka mina al-ula
sad.translation: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first life.

sad.arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰ
sad.transliteration: Walasawfa yu'teeka rabbuka fatarda
sad.translation: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.

sad.arabic: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُم بِشَىْءٍ مِّنَ ٱلْخَوْفِ وَٱلْجُوعِ وَنَقْصٍ مِّنَ ٱلْأَمْوَٰلِ وَٱلْأَنفُسِ وَٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
sad.transliteration: Walanabluwannakum bishay'in mina alkhawfi waljoo'i wanaqsin mina al-amwali wal-anfusi waththamarat wabashiri assabireen
sad.translation: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient.

sad.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَصَـٰبَتْهُم مُّصِيبَةٌ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنَّآ إِلَيْهِ رَٰجِعُونَ
sad.transliteration: Allatheena itha asabat-hum museebatun qalu inna lillahi wa-inna ilayhi raji'oon
sad.translation: Who, when disaster strikes them, say, 'Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return.'

sad.arabic: وَعِبَادُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ ٱلْجَـٰهِلُونَ قَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًا
sad.transliteration: Wa'ibadu arrahmani allatheena yamshoona 'ala al-ardi hawnan wa-itha khatabahumu aljahiloona qaloo salaman
sad.translation: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth in humility, and when the ignorant address them harshly, they say words of peace.

sad.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِى فَٱغْفِرْ لِى فَغَفَرَ لَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
sad.transliteration: Qala rabbi innee thalamtu nafsee faghfir lee faghafara lahu innahu huwa alghafooru arraheem
sad.translation: He said, 'My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me,' and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

sad.arabic: فَسَقَىٰ لَهُمَا ثُمَّ تَوَلَّىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلظِّلِّ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى لِمَآ أَنزَلْتَ إِلَىَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيرٌ
sad.transliteration: Fasaqa lahuma thumma tawalla ila aththilli faqala rabbi innee lima anzalta ilayya min khayrin faqeer
sad.translation: So he watered their flocks for them; then he went back to the shade and said, 'My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need.'

sad.arabic: فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
sad.transliteration: Faqultu istaghfiroo rabbakum innahu kana ghaffaran
sad.translation: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.'

sad.arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغْ قُلُوبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْوَهَّابُ
sad.transliteration: Rabbana la tuzigh quloobana ba'da ith hadaytana wahab lana min ladunka rahmatan innaka anta alwahhab
sad.translation: Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.

sad.arabic: وَزَكَرِيَّآ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِى فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ
sad.transliteration: Wazakariyya ith nada rabbahu rabbi la tatharnee fardan wa-anta khayru alwaritheen
sad.translation: And mention Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, 'My Lord, do not leave me alone as heir, and You are the best of inheritors.'

sad.arabic: قَدْ كَانَتْ لَكُمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ فِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ إِذْ قَالُوا لِقَوْمِهِمْ إِنَّا بُرَآءُ مِنْكُمْ وَمِمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ كَفَرْنَا بِكُمْ وَبَدَا بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمُ الْعَدَاوَةُ وَالْبَغْضَاءُ أَبَدًا حَتَّىٰ تُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَحْدَهُ إِلَّا قَوْلَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ لِأَبِيهِ لَأَسْتَغْفِرَنَّ لَكَ وَمَا أَمْلِكُ لَكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۖ رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ
sad.transliteration: Qad kanat lakum uswatun hasanatun fee ibraheema wallatheena ma'ahu ith qaloo liqawmihim inna bura-ao minkum wamimma ta'budoona min dooni Allahi kafarna bikum wabada baynana wabaynakumu al'adawatu walbaghdao abadan hatta tu/minoo biAllahi wahdahu illa qawla ibraheema li-abeehi la-astaghfiranna laka wama amliku laka mina Allahi min shay-in rabbana 'alayka tawakkalna wa-ilayka anabna wa-ilayka almaseer
sad.translation: There has already been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, 'Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone' except for the saying of Abraham to his father, 'I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not power to do anything for you against Allah.' Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

sad.arabic: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُم بِشَىْءٍ مِّنَ ٱلْخَوْفِ وَٱلْجُوعِ وَنَقْصٍ مِّنَ ٱلْأَمْوَٰلِ وَٱلْأَنفُسِ وَٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
sad.transliteration: Walanabluwannakum bishay'in mina alkhawfi waljoo'i wanaqsin mina al-amwali wal-anfusi waththamarat wabashiri assabireen
sad.translation: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient.

sad.arabic: وَأَنفِقُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَلَا تُلْقُوا بِأَيْدِيكُمْ إِلَى التَّهْلُكَةِ ۛ وَأَحْسِنُوا ۛ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
sad.transliteration: Wa-anfiqoo fee sabeeli Allahi wala tulqoo bi-aydeekum ila attahlukati wa-ahsinoo inna Allaha yuhibbu almuhsineen
sad.translation: And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw yourselves with your own hands into destruction. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.

sad.arabic: وَيَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَحْتَسِبُ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى اللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسْبُهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بَالِغُ أَمْرِهِ ۚ قَدْ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدْرًا
sad.transliteration: Wayarzuqhu min haythu la yahtasibu waman yatawakkal 'ala Allahi fahuwa hasbuhu inna Allaha balighu amrihi qad ja'ala Allahu likulli shay-in qadra
sad.translation: And will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a decreed extent.

sad.arabic: فَٱذْكُرُونِىٓ أَذْكُرْكُمْ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لِى وَلَا تَكْفُرُونِ
sad.transliteration: Fathkurooni athkurkum washkuroo lee wala takfuroon
sad.translation: So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.

sad.arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا وَمَا يَنزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا يَعْرُجُ فِيهَا ۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
sad.transliteration: Huwa allathee khalaqa alssamawati waal-arda fee sittati ayyamin thumma istawa 'ala al'arshi ya'lamu ma yaliju fee al-ardi wama yakhruju minha wama yanzilu mina alssamai wama ya'ruju feeha wahuwa ma'akum ayna ma kuntum waAllahu bima ta'maloona baseer
sad.translation: It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.

sad.arabic: لَهُ مُعَقِّبَاتٌ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ يَحْفَظُونَهُ مِنْ أَمْرِ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُغَيِّرُ مَا بِقَوْمٍ حَتَّىٰ يُغَيِّرُوا مَا بِأَنْفُسِهِمْ ۗ وَإِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِقَوْمٍ سُوءًا فَلَا مَرَدَّ لَهُ ۚ وَمَا لَهُمْ مِنْ دُونِهِ مِنْ وَالٍ
sad.transliteration: Lahu mu'aqqibatun min bayni yadayhi wamin khalfihi yahfathoonahu min amri Allahi inna Allaha la yughayyiru ma biqawmin hatta yughayyiroo ma bi-anfusihim wa-itha arada Allahu biqawmin soo-an fala maradda lahu wama lahum min doonihi min walin
sad.translation: For him are successive angels before and behind him who protect him by the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allah intends for a people ill, there is no repelling it. And there is not for them besides Him any patron.

sad.arabic: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلْمُنتَهَىٰ
sad.transliteration: Wa-anna ila rabbika almuntaha
sad.translation: And that to your Lord is the finality.

sad.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
sad.transliteration: Wallahu ya'lamu ma tusirroona wama tu'linoon
sad.translation: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare.

sad.arabic: قَالَ هَلْ آمَنُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا كَمَا أَمِنتُكُمْ عَلَىٰ أَخِيهِ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ فَاللَّهُ خَيْرٌ حَافِظًا ۖ وَهُوَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
sad.transliteration: Qala hal amanukum 'alayhi illa kama amintukum 'ala akheehi min qablu fallahu khayrun hafithan wahuwa arhamu arrahimeen
sad.translation: He said, 'Should I entrust you with him except as I entrusted you with his brother before? But Allah is the best guardian, and He is the most merciful of the merciful.'

sad.arabic: وَلَا تَقْفُ مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْبَصَرَ وَٱلْفُؤَادَ كُلُّ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ كَانَ عَنْهُ مَسْـُٔولًا
sad.transliteration: Wala taqfu ma laysa laka bihi 'ilm inna assamAAa walbbasara walfuada kullu ola-ika kana AAanhu masoolan
sad.translation: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those one will be questioned.

sad.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَائِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَالْفَوَاحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَاسِعُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوا أَنفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ
sad.transliteration: Allatheena yajtaniboona kaba-ira al-ithmi walfawahisha illa allamam inna rabbaka wasi'u almaghfirati huwa a'lamu bikum ith ansha-akum mina al-ardi wa-ith antum ajinnatun fee butooni ommahatikum fala tuzakkoo anfusakum huwa a'lamu bimani ittaqa
sad.translation: Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.

anxious.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَطْمَئِنُّ قُلُوبُهُم بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ أَلَا بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ ٱلْقُلُوبُ
anxious.transliteration: Alladhīna āmanū wa-taṭma-innu qulūbuhum bidhikri llāhi, alā bidhikri llāhi taṭma-innu l-qulūbu
anxious.translation: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured.

anxious.arabic: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۚ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا ٱكْتَسَبَتْ ۗ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَآ إِن نَّسِينَآ أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَآ إِصْرًۭا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦ ۖ وَٱعْفُ عَنَّا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَآ ۚ أَنتَ مَوْلَىٰنَا فَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
anxious.transliteration: Lā yukallifu llāhu nafsan illā wusʿahā, lahā mā kasabat wa-ʿalayhā mā ktasabat, rabbanā lā tu-ākhidh-nā in nasīnā aw akhṭa-nā, rabbanā wa-lā taḥmil ʿalaynā iṣran kamā ḥamaltahū ʿalā lladhīna min qablinā, rabbanā wa-lā tuḥammilnā mā lā ṭāqata lanā bihī, wa-ʿfu ʿannā wa-ghfir lanā wa-rḥamnā, anta mawlānā fa-nṣurnā ʿalā l-qawmi l-kāfirīn
anxious.translation: Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. 'Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.'

anxious.arabic: وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسْبُهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بَـٰلِغُ أَمْرِهِۦ ۚ قَدْ جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدْرًا
anxious.transliteration: Wa-man yatawakkal ʿalā llāhi fa-huwa ḥasbuhū, inna llāha bālighu amrihī, qad jaʿala llāhu likulli shay-in qadrā
anxious.translation: And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.

anxious.arabic: قُل لَّن يُصِيبَنَآ إِلَّا مَا كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ لَنَا هُوَ مَوْلَىٰنَا ۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
anxious.transliteration: Qul lan yuṣībanā illā mā kataba llāhu lanā, huwa mawlānā, wa-ʿalā llāhi fa-l-yatawakkali l-muʾminūn
anxious.translation: Say, 'Never will we be struck except by what Allah has decreed for us; He is our protector.' And upon Allah let the believers rely.

anxious.arabic: إِن يَنصُرْكُمُ ٱللَّهُ فَلَا غَالِبَ لَكُمْ ۖ وَإِن يَخْذُلْكُمْ فَمَن ذَا ٱلَّذِى يَنصُرُكُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ ۗ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
anxious.transliteration: In yanṣur-kumu llāhu fa-lā ghāliba lakum, wa-in yakhdhul-kum fa-man dhā lladhī yanṣuru-kum min baʿdihī, wa-ʿalā llāhi fa-l-yatawakkali l-muʾminūn
anxious.translation: If Allah should aid you, no one can overcome you; but if He should forsake you, who is there that can aid you after Him? And upon Allah let the believers rely.

anxious.arabic: وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَلَا تَنَـٰزَعُوا۟ فَتَفْشَلُوا۟ وَتَذْهَبَ رِيحُكُمْ ۖ وَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
anxious.transliteration: Wa-aṭīʿū llāha wa-rasūlahū wa-lā tanāzaʿū fa-tafshalū wa-tadhhaba rīḥu-kum, wa-ṣbirū, inna llāha maʿa ṣ-ṣābirīn
anxious.translation: And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute and thus lose courage and then your strength would depart; and be patient. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.

anxious.arabic: إِن تَمْسَسْكُمْ حَسَنَةٌ تَسُؤْهُمْ وَإِن تُصِبْكُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ يَفْرَحُوا۟ بِهَا ۖ وَإِن تَصْبِرُوا۟ وَتَتَّقُوا۟ لَا يَضُرُّكُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌ
anxious.transliteration: In tamsas-kum ḥasanatun tasuʾ-hum, wa-in tuṣib-kum sayyi-atun yafraḥū bihā, wa-in taṣbirū wa-tattaqū lā yaḍurru-kum kayduhum shayʾā, inna llāha bi-mā yaʿmalūna muḥīṭ
anxious.translation: If good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it. And if you are patient and fear Allah, their plot will not harm you at all. Indeed, Allah is encompassing of what they do.

anxious.arabic: وَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّ ٱلْعِزَّةَ لِلَّهِ جَمِيعًا ۚ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
anxious.transliteration: Wa-lā yaḥzun-ka qawluhum, inna l-ʿizzata lillāhi jamīʿā, huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīm
anxious.translation: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, honor [might] belongs to Allah entirely. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

anxious.arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ وَكِيلًا
anxious.transliteration: Wa-tawakkal ʿalā llāhi, wa-kafā bi-llāhi wakīlā
anxious.translation: And rely upon Allah. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.

anxious.arabic: أَلَا إِنَّ أَوْلِيَآءَ ٱللَّهِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
anxious.transliteration: Alā inna awliyāʾa llāhi lā khawfun ʿalayhim wa-lā hum yaḥzanūn
anxious.translation: Unquestionably, for the allies of Allah there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

anxious.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ رَبُّنَا ٱللَّهُ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَقَـٰمُوا۟ تَتَنَزَّلُ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ أَلَّا تَخَافُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَبْشِرُوا۟ بِٱلْجَنَّةِ ٱلَّتِى كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
anxious.transliteration: Inna lladhīna qālū rabbu-nā llāhu thumma staqāmū tatanazzalu ʿalayhi-mu l-malāʾikatu allā takhāfū wa-lā taḥzanū wa-abshirū bi-l-jannati llatī kuntum tūʿadūn
anxious.translation: Indeed, those who have said, 'Our Lord is Allah,' and then remained on a right course - the angels will descend upon them, [saying], 'Do not fear and do not grieve but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised.'

anxious.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّٱلَّذِينَ هُم مُّحْسِنُونَ
anxious.transliteration: Inna llāha maʿa lladhīna ttaqaw wa-lladhīna hum muḥsinūn
anxious.translation: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.

anxious.arabic: لَا تَحْزَنْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَنَا ۖ فَأَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُۥ عَلَيْهِ وَأَيَّدَهُۥ بِجُنُودٍ لَّمْ تَرَوْهَا وَجَعَلَ كَلِمَةَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱلسُّفْلَىٰ ۗ وَكَلِمَةُ ٱللَّهِ هِىَ ٱلْعُلْيَا ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
anxious.transliteration: Lā taḥzan inna llāha maʿanā, fa-anzala llāhu sakīnatahū ʿalayhi wa-ayyadahū bi-junūdin lam taraw-hā, wa-jaʿala kalimata lladhīna kafarū s-suflā, wa-kalimatu llāhi hiya l-ʿulyā, wa-llāhu ʿazīzun ḥakīm
anxious.translation: [He said], 'Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us.' And Allah sent down His tranquility upon him and supported him with soldiers you did not see and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the word of Allah - that is the highest. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

anxious.arabic: وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
anxious.transliteration: Wa-man yatawakkal ʿalā llāhi fa-inna llāha ʿazīzun ḥakīm
anxious.translation: And whoever relies upon Allah - then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

anxious.arabic: أَلَا بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ ٱلْقُلُوبُ
anxious.transliteration: Alā bidhikri llāhi taṭma-innu l-qulūb
anxious.translation: Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured.

anxious.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
anxious.transliteration: Qul yā ʿibādiya lladhīna asrafū ʿalā anfusi-him lā taqnaṭū min raḥmati llāhi, inna llāha yaghfiru dh-dhunūba jamīʿā, innahū huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīm
anxious.translation: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'

anxious.arabic: حَسْبُنَا ٱللَّهُ وَنِعْمَ ٱلْوَكِيلُ
anxious.transliteration: Ḥasbunā llāhu wa-niʿma l-wakīl
anxious.translation: Sufficient for us is Allah, and He is the best Disposer of affairs.

anxious.arabic: لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
anxious.transliteration: Lā takhaf innaka anta l-aʿlā
anxious.translation: 'Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.'

anxious.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
anxious.transliteration: Qāla kallā, inna maʿiya rabbī sayahdīn
anxious.translation: He said, 'No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me.'

anxious.arabic: وَلَا تَحْسَبَنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَـٰفِلًا عَمَّا يَعْمَلُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ ۚ إِنَّمَا يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ لِيَوْمٍ تَشْخَصُ فِيهِ ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرُ
anxious.transliteration: Wa-lā taḥsabanna llāha ghāfilan ʿammā yaʿmalu ẓ-ẓālimūn, innamā yuʾakhkhiruhum li-yawmin tashkhaṣu fīhi l-abṣār
anxious.translation: And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].

anxious.arabic: وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مَخْرَجًا
anxious.transliteration: Wa-man yattaqi llāha yajʿal lahū makhrajā
anxious.translation: And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out.

anxious.arabic: فَبِمَا رَحْمَةٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ لِنتَ لَهُمْ ۖ وَلَوْ كُنتَ فَظًّا غَلِيظَ ٱلْقَلْبِ لَٱنفَضُّوا۟ مِنْ حَوْلِكَ ۖ فَٱعْفُ عَنْهُمْ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ وَشَاوِرْهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَمْرِ ۖ فَإِذَا عَزَمْتَ فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُتَوَكِّلِينَ
anxious.transliteration: Fa-bi-mā raḥmatin mina llāhi linta la-hum, wa-law kunta faẓẓan ghalīẓa l-qalbi la-nfaḍḍū min ḥawlik, fa-ʿfu ʿan-hum wa-staghfir la-hum wa-shāwir-hum fī l-amr, fa-idhā ʿazamta fa-tawakkal ʿalā llāhi, inna llāha yuḥibbu l-mutawakkilīn
anxious.translation: So by mercy from Allah, [O Muhammad], you were lenient with them. And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you. So pardon them and ask forgiveness for them and consult them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon Allah. Indeed, Allah loves those who rely [upon Him].

anxious.arabic: وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ وَلِيًّا وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ نَصِيرًا
anxious.transliteration: Wa-kafā bi-llāhi waliyyan wa-kafā bi-llāhi naṣīrā
anxious.translation: And sufficient is Allah as an ally, and sufficient is Allah as a helper.

anxious.arabic: وَلَا تَيْـَٔسُوا۟ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يَيْـَٔسُ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
anxious.transliteration: Wa-lā tay-asū min rawḥi llāhi, innahū lā yay-asu min rawḥi llāhi illā l-qawmu l-kāfirūn
anxious.translation: And do not despair of relief from Allah. Indeed, no one despairs of relief from Allah except the disbelieving people.

anxious.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
anxious.transliteration: Inna llāha ʿalā kulli shay-in qadīr
anxious.translation: Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

happy.arabic: قُلْ بِفَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَبِرَحْمَتِهِۦ فَبِذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَفْرَحُوا۟ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ
happy.transliteration: Qul bi-faḍli llāhi wa-bi-raḥmatihī fa-bi-dhālika fa-l-yafraḥū, huwa khayrun mimmā yajmaʿūn
happy.translation: Say, 'In the bounty of Allah and in His mercy - in that let them rejoice. It is better than what they accumulate.'

happy.arabic: وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
happy.transliteration: Wa-in taʿuddū niʿmata llāhi lā tuḥṣūhā, inna llāha la-ghafūrun raḥīm
happy.translation: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

happy.arabic: مَنْ عَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَنُحْيِيَنَّهُۥ حَيَوٰةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
happy.transliteration: Man ʿamila ṣāliḥan min dhakarin aw unthā wa-huwa muʾminun fa-la-nuḥyiyanna-hū ḥayātan ṭayyibatan, wa-la-najziyanna-hum ajra-hum bi-aḥsani mā kānū yaʿmalūn
happy.translation: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.

happy.arabic: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
happy.transliteration: Fa-bi-ayyi ālāʾi rabbi-kumā tukadhdhibān
happy.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

happy.arabic: يُؤْتِى ٱلْحِكْمَةَ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَمَن يُؤْتَ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ فَقَدْ أُوتِىَ خَيْرًا كَثِيرًا ۗ وَمَا يَذَّكَّرُ إِلَّآ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
happy.transliteration: Yuʾtī l-ḥikmata man yashāʾ, wa-man yuʾta l-ḥikmata fa-qad ūtiya khayran kathīrā, wa-mā yadhdhakkaru illā ulū l-albāb
happy.translation: He gives wisdom to whom He wills, and whoever has been given wisdom has certainly been given much good. And none will remember except those of understanding.

happy.arabic: فَلَا تَعْلَمُ نَفْسٌ مَّآ أُخْفِىَ لَهُم مِّن قُرَّةِ أَعْيُنٍ جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
happy.transliteration: Fa-lā taʿlamu nafsun mā ukhfiya la-hum min qurrati aʿyunin jazāʾan bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūn
happy.translation: And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes as reward for what they used to do.

happy.arabic: ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ أَنتُمْ وَأَزْوَٰجُكُمْ تُحْبَرُونَ
happy.transliteration: Udkhulū l-jannata antum wa-azwāju-kum tuḥbarūn
happy.translation: Enter Paradise, you and your kinds, delighted.

happy.arabic: يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِصِحَافٍ مِّن ذَهَبٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ ۖ وَفِيهَا مَا تَشْتَهِيهِ ٱلْأَنفُسُ وَتَلَذُّ ٱلْأَعْيُنُ ۖ وَأَنتُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
happy.transliteration: Yuṭāfu ʿalay-him bi-ṣiḥāfin min dhababin wa-akwāb, wa-fīhā mā tashtahīhi l-anfusu wa-taladhdhu l-aʿyun, wa-antum fīhā khālidūn
happy.translation: Circulated among them will be plates and vessels of gold. And therein is whatever the souls desire and what delights the eyes, and you will abide therein eternally.

happy.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
happy.transliteration: Inna l-muttaqīna fī jannātin wa-nahar
happy.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers.

happy.arabic: فَٱنقَلَبُوا۟ بِنِعْمَةٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَفَضْلٍ لَّمْ يَمْسَسْهُمْ سُوٓءٌ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ رِضْوَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو فَضْلٍ عَظِيمٍ
happy.transliteration: Fanqalabū bi-niʿmatin mina llāhi wa-faḍlin lam yamsas-hum sūʾ, wa-ttabaʿū riḍwāna llāhi, wa-llāhu dhū faḍlin ʿaẓīm
happy.translation: So they returned with favor from Allah and bounty, no harm having touched them. And they pursued the pleasure of Allah, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.

happy.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ لَفِى نَعِيمٍ
happy.transliteration: Inna l-abrāra la-fī naʿīm
happy.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure.

happy.arabic: وَمَا ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَآ إِلَّا لَعِبٌ وَلَهْوٌ ۖ وَلَلدَّارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
happy.transliteration: Wa-mā l-ḥayātu d-dunyā illā laʿibun wa-lahw, wa-la-d-dāru l-ākhiratu khayrun li-lladhīna yattaqūn, a-fa-lā taʿqilūn
happy.translation: And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion; but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah. Then will you not reason?

happy.arabic: لِّلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌ ۚ وَلَدَارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ خَيْرٌ ۚ وَلَنِعْمَ دَارُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
happy.transliteration: Li-lladhīna aḥsanū fī hādhihi d-dunyā ḥasanatun, wa-la-dāru l-ākhirati khayr, wa-la-niʿma dāru l-muttaqīn
happy.translation: For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And excellent is the home of the righteous.

happy.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ طُوبَىٰ لَهُمْ وَحُسْنُ مَـَٔابٍ
happy.transliteration: Wa-lladhīna āmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ṭūbā la-hum wa-ḥusnu maʾāb
happy.translation: And those who believed and did righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return.

happy.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ
happy.transliteration: Fa-ammā man aʿṭā wa-ttaqā
happy.translation: As for he who gives and fears Allah.

happy.arabic: رَّضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِىَ رَبَّهُۥ
happy.transliteration: Raḍiya llāhu ʿan-hum wa-raḍū ʿan-hū, dhālika li-man khashiya rabbahū
happy.translation: Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.

happy.arabic: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ يَدْخُلُونَهَا تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَآءُونَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَجْزِى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
happy.transliteration: Jannātu ʿadnin yadkhulūna-hā tajrī min taḥti-hā l-anhār, la-hum fīhā mā yashāʾūn, ka-dhālika yajzī llāhu l-muttaqīn
happy.translation: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous.

happy.arabic: لِّيَجْزِيَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ أَحْسَنَ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَيَزِيدَهُم مِّن فَضْلِهِۦ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَرْزُقُ مَن يَشَآءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
happy.transliteration: Li-yajziya-humu llāhu aḥsana mā ʿamilū wa-yazīda-hum min faḍlihī, wa-llāhu yarzuqu man yashāʾu bi-ghayri ḥisāb
happy.translation: That Allah may reward them according to the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.

happy.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ غُرَفًا تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ نِعْمَ أَجْرُ ٱلْعَـٰمِلِينَ
happy.transliteration: Wa-lladhīna āmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti la-nubawwi-anna-hum mina l-jannati ghurafan tajrī min taḥti-hā l-anhār khālidīna fīhā, niʿma ajru l-ʿāmilīn
happy.translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely assign to them of Paradise elevated chambers beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.

happy.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَهُمْ فِى رَوْضَةٍ يُحْبَرُونَ
happy.transliteration: Fa-ammā lladhīna āmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-hum fī rawḍatin yuḥbarūn
happy.translation: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, they will be in a garden, delighted.

happy.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ ٱلْفِرْدَوْسِ نُزُلًا
happy.transliteration: Inna lladhīna āmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti kanat la-hum jannātu l-firdawsi nuzulā
happy.translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging.

happy.arabic: وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
happy.transliteration: Wa-bashshiri l-muʾminīn
happy.translation: And give good tidings to the believers.

grateful.arabic: وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكُمْ لَئِن شَكَرْتُمْ لَأَزِيدَنَّكُمْ ۖ وَلَئِن كَفَرْتُمْ إِنَّ عَذَابِى لَشَدِيدٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-idh taʾadh-dhana rabbu-kum la-in shakartum la-azīdanna-kum, wa-la-in kafartum inna ʿadhābī la-shadīd
grateful.translation: And remember when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you in favor; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.'

grateful.arabic: فَٱذْكُرُونِىٓ أَذْكُرْكُمْ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لِى وَلَا تَكْفُرُونِ
grateful.transliteration: Fa-dhkurūnī adhkur-kum, wa-shkurū lī wa-lā takfurūn
grateful.translation: So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.

grateful.arabic: وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-in taʿuddū niʿmata llāhi lā tuḥṣūhā, inna llāha la-ghafūrun raḥīm
grateful.translation: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

grateful.arabic: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-ammā bi-niʿmati rabbi-ka fa-ḥaddith
grateful.translation: But as for the favor of your Lord, report it.

grateful.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا لُقْمَـٰنَ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ أَنِ ٱشْكُرْ لِلَّهِ ۚ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-laqad ātaynā luqmāna l-ḥikmata ani shkur lillāh, wa-man shakara fa-innamā yashkuru li-nafsihī, wa-man kafara fa-inna llāha ghaniyyun ḥamīd
grateful.translation: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom and said, 'Be grateful to Allah.' And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for the benefit of himself. And whoever denies - indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

grateful.arabic: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
grateful.transliteration: Qul huwa lladhī anshaʾa-kum wa-jaʿala la-kumu s-samʿa wa-l-abṣāra wa-l-afʾidata, qalīlan mā tashkurūn
grateful.translation: Say, 'It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.'

grateful.arabic: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍۭ
grateful.transliteration: Alladhī aṭʿama-hum min jūʿin wa-āmana-hum min khawf
grateful.translation: Who has fed them, saving them from hunger and made them safe, saving them from fear.

grateful.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا لُقْمَـٰنَ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ أَنِ ٱشْكُرْ لِلَّهِ ۚ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-laqad ātaynā luqmāna l-ḥikmata ani shkur lillāh, wa-man shakara fa-innamā yashkuru li-nafsihī, wa-man kafara fa-inna llāha ghaniyyun ḥamīd
grateful.translation: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom and said, 'Be grateful to Allah.' And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for the benefit of himself. And whoever denies - indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

grateful.arabic: وَءَاتَىٰكُم مِّن كُلِّ مَا سَأَلْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَظَلُومٌ كَفَّارٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-ātā-kum min kulli mā saʾaltumūh, wa-in taʿuddū niʿmata llāhi lā tuḥṣūhā, inna l-insāna la-ẓalūmun kaffār
grateful.translation: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is most unjust and ungrateful.

grateful.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱلْفُلْكَ تَجْرِى فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ بِأَمْرِهِۦ وَيُمْسِكُ ٱلسَّمَآءَ أَن تَقَعَ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِٱلنَّاسِ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
grateful.transliteration: A-lam tara anna llāha sakhkhara la-kum mā fī l-arḍi wa-l-fulka tajrī fī l-baḥri bi-amrihī wa-yumsiku s-samāʾa an taqaʿa ʿalā l-arḍi illā bi-idhni-hī, inna llāha bi-n-nāsi la-raʾūfun raḥīm
grateful.translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which sail through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.

grateful.arabic: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ وَٱلنُّجُومُ مُسَخَّرَٰتٌۢ بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-sakhkhara la-kumu l-layla wa-n-nahāra wa-sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara wa-n-nujūma musakhkharātun bi-amrihī, inna fī dhālika la-āyātin li-qawmin yaʿqilūn
grateful.translation: And He has subjected to you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

grateful.arabic: وَءَاتَىٰكُم مِّن كُلِّ مَا سَأَلْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَظَلُومٌ كَفَّارٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-ātā-kum min kulli mā saʾaltumūh, wa-in taʿuddū niʿmata llāhi lā tuḥṣūhā, inna l-insāna la-ẓalūmun kaffār
grateful.translation: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is most unjust and ungrateful.

grateful.arabic: وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكُمْ لَئِن شَكَرْتُمْ لَأَزِيدَنَّكُمْ ۖ وَلَئِن كَفَرْتُمْ إِنَّ عَذَابِى لَشَدِيدٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-idh taʾadh-dhana rabbu-kum la-in shakartum la-azīdanna-kum, wa-la-in kafartum inna ʿadhābī la-shadīd
grateful.translation: And remember when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you in favor; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.'

grateful.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلًّا فَهَدَىٰ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-wajada-ka ḍāllan fa-hadā
grateful.translation: And He found you lost and guided you.

grateful.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-wajada-ka ʿāʾilan fa-aghna
grateful.translation: And He found you poor and made you self-sufficient.

grateful.arabic: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
grateful.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīn
grateful.translation: All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

grateful.arabic: وَمَآ أُوتِيتُم مِّن شَىْءٍ فَمَتَـٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتُهَا ۚ وَمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-mā ūtītum min shayʾin fa-matāʿu l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-zīnatuhā, wa-mā ʿinda llāhi khayrun wa-abqā, a-fa-lā taʿqilūn
grateful.translation: And whatever thing you have been given - it is but for enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allah is better and more lasting. Then will you not reason?

grateful.arabic: فَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ءَالَآءَ ٱللَّهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
grateful.transliteration: Fa-dhkurū ālāʾa llāhi laʿalla-kum tufliḥūn
grateful.translation: So remember the favors of Allah that you might succeed.

grateful.arabic: وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكُمْ لَئِن شَكَرْتُمْ لَأَزِيدَنَّكُمْ ۖ وَلَئِن كَفَرْتُمْ إِنَّ عَذَابِى لَشَدِيدٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-idh taʾadh-dhana rabbu-kum la-in shakartum la-azīdanna-kum, wa-la-in kafartum inna ʿadhābī la-shadīd
grateful.translation: And remember when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you in favor; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.'

grateful.arabic: فَٱذْكُرُونِىٓ أَذْكُرْكُمْ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لِى وَلَا تَكْفُرُونِ
grateful.transliteration: Fa-dhkurūnī adhkur-kum, wa-shkurū lī wa-lā takfurūn
grateful.translation: So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.

grateful.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِى عِندَهُۥ عِلْمٌ مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُۥ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّى لِيَبْلُوَنِىٓ ءَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّى غَنِىٌّ كَرِيمٌ
grateful.transliteration: Qāla lladhī ʿinda-hū ʿilmun mina l-kitābi anā ātī-ka bi-hī qabla an yartadda ilay-ka ṭarfu-ka, fa-lammā raʾā-hu mustaqirran ʿinda-hū qāla hādhā min faḍli rabbī li-yablūwanī a-ashkuru am akfur, wa-man shakara fa-innamā yashkuru li-nafsihī, wa-man kafara fa-inna rabbī ghaniyyun karīm
grateful.translation: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture, 'I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you.' And when Solomon saw it placed before him, he said, 'This is from the favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for the benefit of himself. And whoever is ungrateful - indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous.'

grateful.arabic: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا مِّنْهُ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-sakhkhara la-kum mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-arḍi jamīʿan min-hū, inna fī dhālika la-āyātin li-qawmin yatafakkarūn
grateful.translation: And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

grateful.arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عَيْنَيْنِ وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ
grateful.transliteration: A-lam najʿal la-hū ʿaynayni wa-lisānan wa-shafatayn
grateful.translation: Have We not made for him two eyes? And a tongue and two lips?

grateful.arabic: وَءَاتَىٰكُم مِّن كُلِّ مَا سَأَلْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَظَلُومٌ كَفَّارٌ
grateful.transliteration: Wa-ātā-kum min kulli mā saʾaltumūh, wa-in taʿuddū niʿmata llāhi lā tuḥṣūhā, inna l-insāna la-ẓalūmun kaffār
grateful.translation: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is most unjust and ungrateful.

grateful.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَأَسْبَغَ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعَمَهُۥ ظَـٰهِرَةً وَبَاطِنَةً ۗ وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يُجَـٰدِلُ فِى ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ وَلَا هُدًى وَلَا كِتَـٰبٍ مُّنِيرٍ
grateful.transliteration: A-lam taraw anna llāha sakhkhara la-kum mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-arḍi wa-asbagha ʿalay-kum niʿama-hū ẓāhira-tan wa-bāṭina-tan, wa-mina n-nāsi man yujādilu fī llāhi bi-ghayri ʿilmin wa-lā hudan wa-lā kitābin munīr
grateful.translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, both apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book.

stressed.arabic: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۚ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا ٱكْتَسَبَتْ ۗ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَآ إِن نَّسِينَآ أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَآ إِصْرًۭا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦ ۖ وَٱعْفُ عَنَّا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَآ ۚ أَنتَ مَوْلَىٰنَا فَٱنصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
stressed.transliteration: Lā yukallifu llāhu nafsan illā wusʿahā, lahā mā kasabat wa-ʿalayhā mā ktasabat, rabbanā lā tu-ākhidh-nā in nasīnā aw akhṭa-nā, rabbanā wa-lā taḥmil ʿalaynā iṣran kamā ḥamaltahū ʿalā lladhīna min qablinā, rabbanā wa-lā tuḥammilnā mā lā ṭāqata lanā bihī, wa-ʿfu ʿannā wa-ghfir lanā wa-rḥamnā, anta mawlānā fa-nṣurnā ʿalā l-qawmi l-kāfirīn
stressed.translation: Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. 'Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.'

stressed.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا ۝ إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
stressed.transliteration: Fa-inna maʿa l-ʿusri yusrā, inna maʿa l-ʿusri yusrā
stressed.translation: For indeed, with hardship will be ease. Indeed, with hardship will be ease.

stressed.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَطْمَئِنُّ قُلُوبُهُم بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ أَلَا بِذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ تَطْمَئِنُّ ٱلْقُلُوبُ
stressed.transliteration: Alladhīna āmanū wa-taṭma-innu qulūbuhum bidhikri llāhi, alā bidhikri llāhi taṭma-innu l-qulūbu
stressed.translation: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured.

stressed.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
stressed.transliteration: Yā ayyu-hā lladhīna āmanu staʿīnū bi-ṣ-ṣabri wa-ṣ-ṣalāti, inna llāha maʿa ṣ-ṣābirīn
stressed.translation: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.

stressed.arabic: وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مَخْرَجًا
stressed.transliteration: Wa-man yattaqi llāha yajʿal lahū makhrajā
stressed.translation: And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out.

stressed.arabic: وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسْبُهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بَـٰلِغُ أَمْرِهِۦ ۚ قَدْ جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدْرًا
stressed.transliteration: Wa-man yatawakkal ʿalā llāhi fa-huwa ḥasbuhū, inna llāha bālighu amrihī, qad jaʿala llāhu likulli shay-in qadrā
stressed.translation: And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.

stressed.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱصْبِرُوا۟ وَصَابِرُوا۟ وَرَابِطُوا۟ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
stressed.transliteration: Yā ayyu-hā lladhīna āmanu ṣbirū wa-ṣābirū wa-rābiṭū wa-ttaqū llāha laʿalla-kum tufliḥūn
stressed.translation: O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.

stressed.arabic: أَحَسِبَ ٱلنَّاسُ أَن يُتْرَكُوٓا۟ أَن يَقُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا وَهُمْ لَا يُفْتَنُونَ
stressed.transliteration: A-ḥasiba n-nāsu an yutrakū an yaqūlū āmannā wa-hum lā yuftanūn
stressed.translation: Do the people think that they will be left to say, 'We believe' and they will not be tried?

stressed.arabic: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۖ فَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ صَدَقُوا۟ وَلَيَعْلَمَنَّ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-laqad fatannā lladhīna min qablihim fa-la-yaʿlamanna llāhu lladhīna ṣadaqū wa-la-yaʿlamanna l-kādhibīn
stressed.translation: But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars.

stressed.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا
stressed.transliteration: Fa-ṣbir ṣabran jamīlā
stressed.translation: So be patient with gracious patience.

stressed.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا أَصَابَكَ ۖ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عَزْمِ ٱلْأُمُورِ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-ṣbir ʿalā mā aṣāba-ka, inna dhālika min ʿazmi l-umūr
stressed.translation: And be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, all that is of the matters requiring determination.

stressed.arabic: إِنَّمَا يُوَفَّى ٱلصَّـٰبِرُونَ أَجْرَهُم بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
stressed.transliteration: Innamā yuwaffā ṣ-ṣābirūna ajra-hum bi-ghayri ḥisāb
stressed.translation: Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account.

stressed.arabic: وَبَشِّرِ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-bashshiri ṣ-ṣābirīn
stressed.translation: And give good tidings to the patient.

stressed.arabic: وَٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ ۚ وَإِنَّهَا لَكَبِيرَةٌ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلْخَـٰشِعِينَ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-staʿīnū bi-ṣ-ṣabri wa-ṣ-ṣalāti, wa-innahā la-kabīratun illā ʿalā l-khāshiʿīn
stressed.translation: And seek help through patience and prayer, and indeed, it is difficult except for the humbly submissive to Allah.

stressed.arabic: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَعْلَمَ ٱلْمُجَـٰهِدِينَ مِنكُمْ وَٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ وَنَبْلُوَ أَخْبَارَكُمْ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-la-nabluwanna-kum ḥattā naʿlama l-mujāhidīna min-kum wa-ṣ-ṣābirīna wa-nabluwa akhbāra-kum
stressed.translation: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you and the patient, and We will test your affairs.

stressed.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱصْبِرُوا۟ وَصَابِرُوا۟ وَرَابِطُوا۟ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
stressed.transliteration: Yā ayyu-hā lladhīna āmanu ṣbirū wa-ṣābirū wa-rābiṭū wa-ttaqū llāha laʿalla-kum tufliḥūn
stressed.translation: O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.

stressed.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَخِفَّنَّكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُوقِنُونَ
stressed.transliteration: Fa-ṣbir inna waʿda llāhi ḥaqq, wa-lā yastakhiffanna-ka lladhīna lā yūqinūn
stressed.translation: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let not those who have no certainty of faith discourage you.

stressed.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ وَمَا صَبْرُكَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُن فِى ضَيْقٍ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-ṣbir wa-mā ṣabru-ka illā bi-llāhi, wa-lā taḥzan ʿalay-him wa-lā takun fī ḍayqin mimmā yamkurūn
stressed.translation: And be patient, and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

stressed.arabic: وَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَوْنَ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-lā tahinū wa-lā taḥzanū wa-antumu l-aʿlawna in kuntum muʾminīn
stressed.translation: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are true believers.

stressed.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
stressed.transliteration: Yā ayyu-hā lladhīna āmanu staʿīnū bi-ṣ-ṣabri wa-ṣ-ṣalāti, inna llāha maʿa ṣ-ṣābirīn
stressed.translation: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.

stressed.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ وَمَا صَبْرُكَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُن فِى ضَيْقٍ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-ṣbir wa-mā ṣabru-ka illā bi-llāhi, wa-lā taḥzan ʿalay-him wa-lā takun fī ḍayqin mimmā yamkurūn
stressed.translation: And be patient, and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

stressed.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا ۝ إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
stressed.transliteration: Fa-inna maʿa l-ʿusri yusrā, inna maʿa l-ʿusri yusrā
stressed.translation: For indeed, with hardship will be ease. Indeed, with hardship will be ease.

stressed.arabic: يُرِيدُ ٱللَّهُ أَن يُخَفِّفَ عَنكُمْ ۚ وَخُلِقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ ضَعِيفًا
stressed.transliteration: Yurīdu llāhu an yukhaffifa ʿan-kum, wa-khuliqa l-insānu ḍaʿīfā
stressed.translation: Allah wants to lighten for you your difficulties; and mankind was created weak.

stressed.arabic: وَلَا تَقُولَنَّ لِشَا۟ىْءٍ إِنِّى فَاعِلٌ ذَٰلِكَ غَدًا إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَٱذْكُر رَّبَّكَ إِذَا نَسِيتَ وَقُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِ رَبِّى لِأَقْرَبَ مِنْ هَـٰذَا رَشَدًا
stressed.transliteration: Wa-lā taqūlanna li-shay-in innī fāʿilun dhālika ghadan illā an yashāʾa llāhu, wa-dhkur rabba-ka idhā nasīta wa-qul ʿasā an yahdiyanī rabbī li-aqraba min hādhā rashadā
stressed.translation: And never say of anything, 'Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,' Except when adding, 'If Allah wills.' And remember your Lord when you forget and say, 'Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct.'

stressed.arabic: لِيُنفِقْ ذُو سَعَةٍ مِّن سَعَتِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن قُدِرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقُهُۥ فَلْيُنفِقْ مِمَّآ ءَاتَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا مَآ ءَاتَىٰهَا ۚ سَيَجْعَلُ ٱللَّهُ بَعْدَ عُسْرٍ يُسْرًا
stressed.transliteration: Li-yunfiq dhū saʿatin min saʿatihī, wa-man qudira ʿalay-hi rizqu-hū fa-lyunfiq mimmā ātā-hu llāhu, lā yukallifu llāhu nafsan illā mā ātā-hā, sa-yajʿalu llāhu baʿda ʿusrin yusrā
stressed.translation: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except according to what He has given it. Allah will bring about, after hardship, ease.

stressed.arabic: وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
stressed.transliteration: Wa-man yatawakkal ʿalā llāhi fa-inna llāha ʿazīzun ḥakīm
stressed.translation: And whoever relies upon Allah - then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

hopeful.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
hopeful.transliteration: Fa-inna maʿa l-ʿusri yusrā
hopeful.translation: For indeed, with hardship will be ease.

hopeful.arabic: وَلَا تَيْـَٔسُوا۟ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يَيْـَٔسُ مِن رَّوْحِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-lā tay-asū min rawḥi llāhi, innahū lā yay-asu min rawḥi llāhi illā l-qawmu l-kāfirūn
hopeful.translation: And do not despair of relief from Allah. Indeed, no one despairs of relief from Allah except the disbelieving people.

hopeful.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
hopeful.transliteration: Qul yā ʿibādiya lladhīna asrafū ʿalā anfusi-him lā taqnaṭū min raḥmati llāhi, inna llāha yaghfiru dh-dhunūba jamīʿā, innahū huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīm
hopeful.translation: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'

hopeful.arabic: وَإِذَا سَأَلَكَ عِبَادِى عَنِّى فَإِنِّى قَرِيبٌ ۖ أُجِيبُ دَعْوَةَ ٱلدَّاعِ إِذَا دَعَانِ ۖ فَلْيَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لِى وَلْيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِى لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْشُدُونَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-idhā saʾala-ka ʿibādī ʿannī fa-innī qarīb, ujību daʿwata d-dāʿi idhā daʿān, fa-l-yastajībū lī wa-l-yuʾminū bī laʿalla-hum yarshudūn
hopeful.translation: And when My servants ask you concerning Me - indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me and believe in Me that they may be rightly guided.

hopeful.arabic: وَقَالَ رَبُّكُمُ ٱدْعُونِىٓ أَسْتَجِبْ لَكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِى سَيَدْخُلُونَ جَهَنَّمَ دَاخِرِينَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-qāla rabbu-kumu dʿūnī astajib la-kum, inna lladhīna yastakbirūna ʿan ʿibādatī sa-yadkhulūna jahannama dākhirīn
hopeful.translation: And your Lord says, 'Call upon Me; I will respond to you.' Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell humiliated.

hopeful.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-ṣbir fa-inna llāha lā yuḍīʿu ajra l-muḥsinīn
hopeful.translation: And be patient, for indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.

hopeful.arabic: وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ ثُمَّ تُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى رَحِيمٌ وَدُودٌ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-staghfirū rabba-kum thumma tūbū ilay-hi, inna rabbī raḥīmun wadūd
hopeful.translation: And ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is Merciful and Affectionate.

hopeful.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَخِفَّنَّكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُوقِنُونَ
hopeful.transliteration: Fa-ṣbir inna waʿda llāhi ḥaqq, wa-lā yastakhiffanna-ka lladhīna lā yūqinūn
hopeful.translation: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let not those who have no certainty of faith discourage you.

hopeful.arabic: مَآ أَصَابَ مِن مُّصِيبَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ يَهْدِ قَلْbَهُۥ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
hopeful.transliteration: Mā aṣāba min muṣībatin illā bi-idhni llāhi, wa-man yuʾmin bi-llāhi yahdi qalba-hū, wa-llāhu bi-kulli shay-in ʿalīm
hopeful.translation: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things.

hopeful.arabic: أَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ أَن تَدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَمَّا يَأْتِكُم مَّثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوْا۟ مِن قَبْلِكُم ۖ مَّسَّتْهُمُ ٱلْبَأْسَآءُ وَٱلضَّرَّآءُ وَزُلْزِلُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَقُولُوا۟ ٱلرَّسُولُ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ مَتَىٰ نَصْرُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّ نَصْرَ ٱللَّهِ قَرِيبٌ
hopeful.transliteration: Am ḥasibtum an tadkhulū l-jannata wa-lammā yaʾti-kum mathalu lladhīna khalaw min qabli-kum, massat-hu-mu l-baʾsāʾu wa-ḍ-ḍarrāʾu wa-zulzilū ḥattā yaqūlu r-rasūlu wa-lladhīna āmanū maʿa-hū matā naṣru llāh, alā inna naṣra llāhi qarīb
hopeful.translation: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such trial has not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until even the messenger and those who believed with him said, 'When is the help of Allah?' Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.

hopeful.arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
hopeful.transliteration: Inna maʿa l-ʿusri yusrā
hopeful.translation: Indeed, with hardship will be ease.

hopeful.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُنَزِّلُ ٱلْغَيْثَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا قَنَطُوا۟ وَيَنشُرُ رَحْمَتَهُۥ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْوَلِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-huwa lladhī yunazzilu l-ghaytha min baʿdi mā qanaṭū wa-yanshuru raḥmata-hū, wa-huwa l-waliyyu l-ḥamīd
hopeful.translation: And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.

hopeful.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ أَحْsَنُوا۟ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌ ۗ وَأَرْضُ ٱللَّهِ وَٰسِعَةٌ ۗ إِنَّمَا يُوَفَّى ٱلصَّـٰبِرُونَ أَجْرَهُم بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
hopeful.transliteration: Qul yā ʿibādi lladhīna āmanū ttaqū rabba-kum, li-lladhīna aḥsanū fī hādhihi d-dunyā ḥasanatun, wa-arḍu llāhi wāsiʿatun, innamā yuwaffā ṣ-ṣābirūna ajra-hum bi-ghayri ḥisāb
hopeful.translation: Say, 'O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of Allah is spacious. Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account.'

hopeful.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
hopeful.transliteration: Qul yā ʿibādiya lladhīna asrafū ʿalā anfusi-him lā taqnaṭū min raḥmati llāhi, inna llāha yaghfiru dh-dhunūba jamīʿā, innahū huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīm
hopeful.translation: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'

hopeful.arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
hopeful.transliteration: Rabbanā innanā āmannā fa-ghfir lanā dhunūbanā wa-qinā ʿadhāba n-nār
hopeful.translation: Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

hopeful.arabic: كَتَبَ رَبُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ ٱلرَّحْمَةَ ۖ أَنَّهُۥ مَنْ عَمِلَ مِنكُمْ سُوٓءًۢا بِجَهَـٰلَةٍ ثُمَّ تَابَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ وَأَصْلَحَ فَأَنَّهُۥ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
hopeful.transliteration: Kataba rabbu-kum ʿalā nafsihi r-raḥmata annahū man ʿamila min-kum sūʾan bi-jahālatin thumma tāba min baʿdi-hī wa-aṣlaḥa fa-annahū ghafūrun raḥīm
hopeful.translation: Your Lord has written for Himself mercy: that any of you who does evil out of ignorance and then repents after that and corrects himself - indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.

hopeful.arabic: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ مِن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ نَقِيرًا
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-man yaʿmal mina ṣ-ṣāliḥāti min dhakarin aw unthā wa-huwa muʾminun fa-ulāʾika yadkhulūna l-jannata wa-lā yuẓlamūna naqīrā
hopeful.translation: And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer - those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged, even as much as the speck on a date seed.

hopeful.arabic: رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ ٱلنَّاسِ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
hopeful.transliteration: Rabbanā innaka jāmiʿu n-nāsi li-yawmin lā rayba fī-h, inna llāha lā yukhlifu l-mīʿād
hopeful.translation: Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.

hopeful.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ٱبْيَضَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فَفِى رَحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-ammā lladhīna b-yaḍḍat wujūhu-hum fa-fī raḥmati llāhi hum fī-hā khālidūn
hopeful.translation: But as for those whose faces will turn white, they will be in Allah's mercy, abiding therein eternally.

hopeful.arabic: إِن تَتُوبَآ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ فَقَدْ صَغَتْ قُلُوبُكُمَا ۖ وَإِن تَظَـٰهَرَا عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ مَوْلَىٰهُ وَجِبْرِيلُ وَصَـٰلِحُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ ظَهِيرٌ
hopeful.transliteration: In tattūbā ilā llāhi fa-qad ṣaghat qulūbu-kumā, wa-in taẓāharā ʿalay-hi fa-inna llāha huwa mawlā-hū wa-jibrīlu wa-ṣāliḥu l-muʾminīna wa-l-malāʾikatu baʿda dhālika ẓahīr
hopeful.translation: If you two repent to Allah, then your hearts have already inclined. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed Allah is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are his assistants.

hopeful.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِى ٱشْتَرَىٰهُ مِن مِّصْرَ لِٱمْرَأَتِهِۦٓ أَكْرِمِى مَثْوَاهُ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَنفَعَنَآ أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُۥ وَلَدًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَكَّنَّا لِيُوسُفَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُۥ مِن تَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحَادِيثِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَالِبٌ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرِهِۦ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-qāla lladhī shtarā-hū min miṣra li-mraʾati-hī akrimī mathwā-hū ʿasā an yanfaʿanā aw nattakhidha-hū waladā, wa-ka-dhālika makkannā li-yūsufa fī l-arḍi wa-li-nuʿallima-hū min taʾwīli l-aḥādīth, wa-llāhu ghālibun ʿalā amri-hī wa-lākinna akthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūn
hopeful.translation: And the one from Egypt who bought him said to his wife, 'Make his residence comfortable. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a son.' And thus, We established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah is predominant over His affair, but most of the people do not know.

hopeful.arabic: وَرَفَعَ أَبَوَيْهِ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ وَخَرُّوا۟ لَهُۥ سُجَّدًا ۖ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ هَـٰذَا تَأْوِيلُ رُءْيَـٰىَ مِن قَبْلُ قَدْ جَعَلَهَا رَبِّى حَقًّا ۖ وَقَدْ أَحْسَنَ بِىٓ إِذْ أَخْرَجَنِى مِنَ ٱلسِّجْنِ وَجَآءَ بِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْبَدْوِ مِنۢ بَعْdِ إِن يَشَأْ رَبِّى ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-rafaʿa abaway-hi ʿalā l-ʿarshi wa-kharrū la-hū sujjadā, wa-qāla yā abati hādhā taʾwīlu ruʾyā-ya min qablu qad jaʿala-hā rabbī ḥaqqā, wa-qad aḥsana bī idh akhraja-nī mina s-sijni wa-jāʾa bi-kum mina l-badwi min baʿdi an yazigha sh-shayṭānu baynī wa-bayna ikhwati, inna rabbī laṭīfun li-mā yashāʾ, innahū huwa l-ʿalīmu l-ḥakīm
hopeful.translation: And he raised his parents upon the throne, and they bowed to him in prostration. And he said, 'O my father, this is the explanation of my vision of before. My Lord has made it reality. And He was certainly good to me when He took me out of prison and brought you here from bedouin life after Satan had induced estrangement between me and my brothers. Indeed, my Lord is Subtle in what He wills. Indeed, it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise.'

hopeful.arabic: وَعَسَىٰٓ أَن تَكْرَهُوا۟ شَيْـًٔا وَهُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ ۖ وَعَسَىٰٓ أَن تُحِبُّوا۟ شَيْـًٔا وَهُوَ شَرٌّ لَّكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-ʿasā an takrahū shay-an wa-huwa khayrun la-kum, wa-ʿasā an tuḥibbū shay-an wa-huwa sharrun la-kum, wa-llāhu yaʿlamu wa-antum lā taʿlamūn
hopeful.translation: But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah knows, while you know not.

hopeful.arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-la-sawfa yuʿṭī-ka rabbu-ka fa-tarḍā
hopeful.translation: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.

hopeful.arabic: قَالُوا۟ أَءِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ يُوسُفُ ۖ قَالَ أَنَا۠ يُوسُفُ وَهَـٰذَآ أَخِى ۖ قَدْ مَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَآ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ مَن يَتَّقِ وَيَصْبِرْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
hopeful.transliteration: Qālū a-innaka la-anta yūsuf, qāla anā yūsufu wa-hādhā akhī, qad manna llāhu ʿalaynā, innahū man yattaqi wa-yaṣbir fa-inna llāha lā yuḍīʿu ajra l-muḥsinīn
hopeful.translation: They said, 'Are you indeed Joseph?' He said, 'I am Joseph, and this is my brother. Allah has certainly favored us. Indeed, he who fears Allah and is patient - then indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.'

hopeful.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا۟ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ ٱلذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
hopeful.transliteration: Qul yā ʿibādiya lladhīna asrafū ʿalā anfusi-him lā taqnaṭū min raḥmati llāhi, inna llāha yaghfiru dh-dhunūba jamīʿā, innahū huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīm
hopeful.translation: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'

hopeful.arabic: وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسْبُهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بَـٰلِغُ أَمْرِهِۦ ۚ قَدْ جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدْرًا
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-man yatawakkal ʿalā llāhi fa-huwa ḥasbuhū, inna llāha bālighu amrihī, qad jaʿala llāhu likulli shay-in qadrā
hopeful.translation: And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.

hopeful.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ حَقَّ تُقَاتِهِۦ وَلَا تَمُوتُنَّ إِلَّا وَأَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
hopeful.transliteration: Yā ayyu-hā lladhīna āmanū ttaqū llāha ḥaqqa tuqāti-hī wa-lā tamūtunna illā wa-antum muslimūn
hopeful.translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims.

hopeful.arabic: وَأَنفِقُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تُلْقُوا۟ بِأَيْدِيكُمْ إِلَى ٱلتَّهْلُكَةِ ۛ وَأَحْسِنُوٓا۟ ۛ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُحْsِنِينَ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-anfiqū fī sabīli llāhi wa-lā tulqū bi-aydī-kum ilā t-tahlukati wa-aḥsinū, inna llāha yuḥibbu l-muḥsinīn
hopeful.translation: And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw yourselves into destruction. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.

hopeful.arabic: فَٱسْتَقِمْ كَمَآ أُمِرْتَ وَمَن تَابَ مَعَكَ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
hopeful.transliteration: Fa-staqim kamā umirta wa-man tāba maʿa-ka wa-lā taṭghaw, innahū bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīr
hopeful.translation: So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, you and those who have turned back with you, and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

hopeful.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِن كُنتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّى وَرَزَقَنِى مِنْهُ رِزْقًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُخَالِفَكُمْ إِلَىٰ مَآ أَنْهَىٰكُمْ عَنْهُ ۚ إِنْ أُرِيدُ إِلَّا ٱلْإِصْلَـٰحَ مَا ٱسْتَطَعْتُ ۚ وَمَا تَوْفِيقِىٓ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَإِلَيْهِ أُنِيبُ
hopeful.transliteration: Qāla yā qawmi a-raʾaytum in kuntu ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbī wa-razaqa-nī min-hu rizqan ḥasanā, wa-mā urīdu an ukhālifa-kum ilā mā anhā-kum ʿan-hū, in urīdu illā l-iṣlāḥa mā istaṭaʿtu, wa-mā tawfīqī illā bi-llāhi, ʿalay-hi tawakkaltu wa-ilay-hi unīb
hopeful.translation: He said, 'O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has provided me with a good provision from Him...? And I do not intend to differ from you in that which I have forbidden you; I only intend reform as much as I am able. And my success is not but through Allah. Upon Him I have relied, and to Him I return.'

hopeful.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا ٱلْقِبْلَةَ ٱلَّتِى كُنتَ عَلَيْهَآ إِلَّا لِنَعْلَمَ مَن يَتَّبِعُ ٱلرَّسُولَ مِمَّن يَنقَلِبُ عَلَىٰ عَقِبَيْهِ ۚ وَإِن كَانَتْ لَكَبِيرَةً إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ هَدَى ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيُضِيعَ إِيمَـٰنَكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِٱلنَّاسِ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
hopeful.transliteration: Wa-mā jaʿalnā l-qiblata llatī kunta ʿalayhā illā li-naʿlama man yattabiʿu r-rasūla mimman yanqalibu ʿalā ʿaqibay-h, wa-in kānat la-kabīratan illā ʿalā lladhīna hadā llāhu, wa-mā kāna llāhu li-yuḍīʿa īmāna-kum, inna llāha bi-n-nāsi la-raʾūfun raḥīm
hopeful.translation: And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels. And indeed, it is difficult except for those whom Allah has guided. And never would Allah have caused you to lose your faith. Indeed Allah is, to the people, Kind and Merciful.
